definition: to take it easy
long or drawn out/remote in time or space/leisurely/to swing/pensive/worried
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: If you want to lose weight，you should go easy on the fried foods.
sentences.chinese: 你想瘦吗，炸的食品你就悠着点吃吧。

sentences.english: Banks in India to take care before making further advance to this sector.
sentences.chinese: 印度银行在给钢铁业提供贷款时应当悠着点。

sentences.english: She told her husband to keep himself under control and not drink too much.
sentences.chinese: 她让她丈夫悠着点儿，别喝太多的酒。

sentences.english: Still, the blogosphere will have to tread lightly when it comes to using AP-related sources.
sentences.chinese: 博客圈在使用美联社内容的时候，还是得悠着点。

sentences.english: I'm so busy, people often tell me to hold your horses.
sentences.chinese: 我太忙了，人们经常告诉我要悠着点。

sentences.english: Watt said the beer should be treated with care when drinking.
sentences.chinese: 沃特说，喝这种啤酒时要悠着点儿。

definition: erhua variant of 可勁|可劲[ke3 jin4]
vigorously/to the utmost/to the best of one's ability
(dialect) oneself/by oneself
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
erhua variant of 點|点[dian3]
erhua variant of 身板[shen1 ban3]
reliable/secure/stable/firm
(dialect) very
contraction of 不用[bu4 yong4]/need not/please don't
thus/in this way/like this
erhua variant of 沒勁|没劲[mei2 jin4]
to take care/to look out
in good condition/perfectly good/carefully/well/thoroughly
to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
to show off one's ability/to boast one's merits
to become exhausted
